chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Christopher Hiller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:46 pm.  Defendant Matthew Christopher Hiller in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Matthew Christopher Hiller in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states the agreement.  State notes some of the cash bond posted has already been provided to the victim per the order for recompense in 17CF407 but the $500 posted in 14CF402 was forfeited.  Parties agree the restitution stipulation should be reduced by $500 due to the previous order for recompense.  Court so orders and he will modify the restitution stipulation.  Court questions DE on the plea agreement.  DE pleads NC to Ct 1 in each case 14CF402 and 17CF407.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  State notes there is no VIS.  Court questions DE re: his waiver of a PSI.  DE waives that right.  Court accepts the waiver of PSI.  State makes statement on behalf of the joint recommendation.  Atty Klopp makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE makes a statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court reminds DE re: voting rights and felony firearms possession.  WEDS form provided to DE.
